The method SimpleTestCollector.isTestClass(String classFileName) is
impleme=
nted faulty:

This is the implementation of junit 3.8.1:
protected boolean =
isTestClass(String classFileName) {
	return 
		classFileName.endsWith(".cla=
ss") && 
		classFileName.indexOf('$') < 0 &&
		classFileName.indexOf("Test"=
) > 0;
}

Using this implementation a test method will not be recognized if=
 it
starts with the term "test" (any case) becaus String.indexOf returns
-1=
 if no substring "test" could be found. If the method name starts
with "tes=
t" String.indexOf returns 0. However, the implementation
quoted above retur=
ns FALSE although the substring "test" could be
found!. Thus, we have to ch=
ange the last LOC to test fpr >=3D 0:

classFileName.indexOf("Test") > 0;

=
Now it works.

Where is the place to post this so that this bug will be cle=
ared?
(...though I could not believe to be the first to find out about this=
.)

Dirk
